    • Method Detail

      • addCredits

        public void addCredits(int value)
        Adds credits as a function of score
        Parameters:
        value - the number of credits to add

      • addScore

        public void addScore(Plane plane,
            Game currentGame)

        This method adds points to the score variable and is used within the Game update(args) method.

        Upon arrival of plane at the end of the runway: Score += 10 * multiplier points

        Upon arrival of plane through any other waypoint: Score += 5 * multiplier points

        Parameters:
        plane - Plane whose position is checked to be a waypoint or not
        currentGame - Used to gain access to airport attributes

      • planeLeftAirspaceOrWaitingToTakeOffMinusScore

        public void planeLeftAirspaceOrWaitingToTakeOffMinusScore()

        Method used within Game - update(args), GameWindow - render(args) methods

        Code within update(args) in Game will check whether a plane is outside of the airspace; if so, this method will be called. Likewise, code within render(args) in GameWindow will call this method if a plane is taking too long to takeoff.

        If the score variable is greater than or equal to 10 * multiplier, then 10 * multiplier is deducted from score. Otherwise the score is set to zero, as 10 * multiplier would result in a negative score.

      • planePilotedPerfectlyMultiplierBonus

        public void planePilotedPerfectlyMultiplierBonus(Plane plane)

        Method used within Game - update(args) method

        Within the update(args) method of Game, a section of the code will test whether any plane's current flight plan length is equal to 0 i.e. whether any flight has finished its flight plan. If it has it will enter a section of code where this method is called; the method checks whether the flight has experienced any collision warnings as it flew through the airspace, if this is the case then no change occurs (as plane.getViolationOccurred() will return true). If no collision warnings have occurred the multiplier is incremented.
        Parameters:
        plane - Plane which is currently being checked

      • planeCollisionWarningMultAndScorePenalties

        public void planeCollisionWarningMultAndScorePenalties()

        Method used within Game - collisionHelper(args) method

        Code within collisionHelper(args) will check whether any planes are close enough to each other to cause a collision warning; if so, this method will be called. If the score variable is greater than or equal to 5 * multiplier, then 5 * multiplier is deducted from the score. If then the multiplier is greater than 1, it is decremented. Otherwise, the score is set to 0 and the multiplier decremented if it is greater than 1.
